sources.label: Wikipedia
sources.name: Wikipedia: List of Fake News Websites
sources.definitions: Sites publish "hoaxes and disinformation for purposes other than news satire."
sources.notes: Crowdsourced with citations to news articles and fact-checkers

sources.label: OpenSources
sources.name: OpenSources
sources.notes: Librarians and researchers manually labeled user-submitted sites. "Basic textual and discursive analysis research methods" were used.

sources.label: MBFC
sources.name: Media Bias/Fact Check
sources.definitions: "questionable sites which exhibit one or more of the following: extreme bias, overt propaganda, poor or no sourcing to credible information and/or is fake news."

sources.label: Allcott18
sources.name: Trends in the Diffusion of Misinformation on Social Media, Allcott et al

sources.label: Grinberg19
sources.name: Fake news on Twitter during the 2016 U.S. presidential election, Grinberg et al

sources.name: PolitiFact's guide to fake news websites and what they peddle

sources.label: NewsGuard
sources.name: NewsGuard
sources.notes: Queried API with 2mil domains from Twitter and all sites from other datasets.
